title: The Office's Jim and Pam stars celebrate characters' 10th anniversary
text:
Jim and Pam celebrate their 10th anniversary today (Picture: NBC/Getty)

The Office US fans have a reason to celebrate today as Jim and Pam Halpert, aka the couple goals to end all couple goals, celebrate their 10-year anniversary.

Seeing as the show is still going strong as a cult favourite, we can totally celebrate it if they’re real, right?

The Dundler Mifflin employees (Played by Jenna Fischer and John Krasinski) started life sharing glances across the office floor and sharing a mutual love of tormenting their co-worker Dwight (Rainn Wilson), but soon no one could deny they were meant to be together.

So when the wedding finally happened, we were all left in floods of tears as the gang trekked out to Niagra Falls and took over the ceremony, complete with dance number.

(Thankfully Jim and Pam had gone and tied the knot by themselves in their own special moment.)

But while the whole day seemed super romantic, it was actually a massive panic to shoot.

Speaking to Entertainment Weekly to celebrate the landmark occasion, actor John said: ‘That day was insane! We had to get it all done in a matter of an hour or so.

‘We had to hide the fact that it was us and try not to let people see the actual wedding in case it got spoiled. On top of it all, I had the flu.

‘So one of the most romantic kisses in the show… is actually just me giving her a huge kiss on the cheek because I didn’t want to get her sick.’

Hey, nothing says love quite like sharing a flu virus, right?

Jim and Pam fell in love working at Dunder Mifflin Paper Company (Picture: NBC/Getty)

But both him and Jenna weren’t prepared for how loved the series became – especially Jim and Pam and their relationship, and for it to continue 10 years later.

Jenna said: ‘I feel like everyone in their love story journey has had a moment of unrequited love or yearning for a person, so I think that kind of hooked people early on. But I really have to give credit to John Krasinski’s performance.

‘In our second episode [of season one], Jim goes after a big sale and Dwight ends up stealing it from him. But in his final talking head, Jim says it was a pretty good day, and he’s saying that because Pam fell asleep on his shoulder.

‘That look on Jim’s face, every woman out there wanted a man to look like that when they talked about her.’

Jim and Pam had what it takes to stand the test of time (Picture: NBC)

‘It makes me so happy [that people still watch],’ she added. ‘It really does deeply resonate with people and is meaningful beyond just being entertaining.’

‘I feel honored and love that the show is still out there and making people laugh.’

John added: ‘To be honest, it’s hard to compute. We all had such a blast and felt that the show was as big as it would ever be when we ended it…. Man, were we wrong!

‘It will always be the greatest honor to have been a part of a show this special.’

The Office US seasons 1-10 is available on Amazon Prime Video in the UK.
